recipes.title: Tasty Teriyaki Chicken Stir-Fry
listIngredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into thin strips
recipes.method:
In a large bowl, toss chicken with 2 tablespoons cornstarch to coat.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 3-5 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add onion, bell pepper, and snow peas. Cook until vegetables are tender, about 3-5 minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk together teriyaki sauce, water, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, sugar, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger. Pour mixture over vegetables in skillet and bring to a boil. Cook until sauce has thickened, about 2-3 minutes.
Add chicken back to skillet and stir to coat with sauce. Serve over rice.

recipes.title: Delicious Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
listIngredients: 1 (10-ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
recipes.method:
Preheat oven to 400Â°F. Line a baking dish with aluminum foil and lightly grease with cooking spray.
Cut a horizontal slit in the thickest part of each chicken breast to form a pocket.
In a bowl, mix together spinach, feta cheese, parsley, and garlic. Divide mixture evenly among chicken pockets, stuffing as much as possible.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, thyme, salt, and pepper. Brush mixture over chicken.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center. Serve with rice or vegetables.
